captions.text:
I don't want to be your friend,
or your brother...or something.
Thing is, I'm attracted to you.
It's quite out of control actually.

Look, I've been around,
it's no big secret.

And I'm done
with this true love trash.
If you want to kiss me, say so.
Don't invent rubbish.

What about all the guys
you've been with?
The talkers...the doers...

A coffee's not going to damn
your virginity now is it?

Wow. So your hands
stay in your pocket huh?

- Will you be my boyfriend?
- Huh?
My boyfriend...
Will you marry me?
Would you like a slap?

Don't fly too high.
Be cool with what you have.
What kind of a girl is Gayatri?
What kind of a guy is he?
Were you born a flirt...

or did you catch an infection
along the way?
You guys run a lot.
You run after each other.
You run away from each other.

When is all this
running going to stop?
Who are you visiting?
My sister...
You're shameless...
So what did you want me to say?
That I'm living in with you?
Can I ask you something?
No thank you.
God knows what you're up to now.

comments.text:
The movie is excellent. It will appeal more to the young generation, who 
would be able to identify themselves in the characters. It is universally 
relevant. Intelligently cryptic and witty... The actors have delivered a 
mature and controlled performance...My special admiration for Vaani Kapoor 
who's got so much confidence, serenity, poise and elegance <3<3<3﻿

comments.text:
For nearly 1000 years, India has survived attempts of deliberate cultural 
destruction and introduction of a new cultural mind set. This is just 
another attempt. Hope Indians have the common sense to survive this 
nonsensical live-in relationship imported from the west. I have been living 
in UK for the past 20 years. I have come across many white people who don't 
know who their real father is because of this so-called live-in 
relationships that lasts until the woman gets pregnant. Then she is left to 
face the challenges of raising a kid alone when her male 'live-in partner' 
absconds. F*CK BOLLYWOD.﻿
